subject: Re: So many "Hack" configurations, so little time
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi Judy,

I found the mixer at Centennial Electronics here in Colorado Springs. 
They had it on a bargin table, marked down from $29 to $8.  The 
amplified speakers are from OEM Electronics here in town.  They have 
tons of used parts, of all sorts.  It's a place the size of a grocery 
store with aisles and aisles of used electronics stuff. Sets of used 
speakers go for around $10.

- Mike

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "judy_in_hollywood" 
<Ticket_to_Heaven@...> wrote:
>
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
<michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> >
> > Okay... I got a brand-spanking new audio mixer today for $8, so I 
just 
> > had to put a new Radio Shack Hack configuration together.
> > See it here: http://ufogeek.com/?p=182
> > 
> > - Mike
> >
>     . . . . . . . . . . . . . .    Hi Mike!  Wow! I really like the 
2 speakers & the small mixer you show on your photo!!  Where did you 
get/find the mixer (for $8) and the 2 speakers (how much)???  I have 
a RS 12-469 that I hacked. I have "El Cheap-o" $1. dual speakers, but 
I have to put the dynamic mic right next to them + put the RS Hack 
volume to max, to record! Not the greatest, but it works. Let me/us 
know, thanks!!   8-))  =Judy=
>
